content:
I dont think this should be a reverse. 
To figure out that you have to find the shortest possible sentence, you have to sift through the longer ones of the test cases,
Maybe I'm missing something, but this seems to be a nigh impossible task.

Edit: Of course I missed something: the hint in the stub. I guess that helps somewhat, but who reads stubs üòè
Still would tend to not have this as a reverse.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it would be fun and interesting to have this in future code clashes

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This clash looks good and it is solvable in five minutes. I like how you made the comment "Shortest_I_Sentence" in the stub generator, so reverse mode isn't completely nonobvious.

Did not get the explanation at first. The mentioning of the word "chain" would help.
And maybe make the example shorter?

5
have a
have the
I had
a cat.
I have

I have a cat.
might be a bit difficult for some players but there is probably a short way to do this so this gets my stamp of approval

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: lgtm. maybe consider removing this from reverse as the "shortest path" thing isn't always clear and some might worry about circular paths but it's not the biggest deal.

All sections
* Please format all the text within double quotation marks as {{constants}}^ and remove the double quotation marks.

^ with the exceptions of "Shortest" and "shortest possible sentence", which may be formatted in <<bold>> or unformatted.

Thanks.
Thanks, great advice. I've implemented it all.

Thanks! :)

Appreciate the feedback.
I've got "Shortest_I_Sentence" as the stub generator answer to help with Reverse, but if others also think it's too hard for Reverse I'll disable.

Thanks for the feedback, I've added the term 'sentence-chain' into the description and I've made the example a bit easier (7 pairs now instead of 9), though still a bit more complex than your suggestion.
I think you're right. Disabling now.
